original_definition: 'resynchronisation point' means the device used to connect two synchronised regions, usually a circuit breaker.
generated_definition: 'resynchronisation point' means the point in time or location where two synchronised regions are connected and synchronised again, typically after a disruption or change in their respective clocks.

Article 3: ‘resynchronisation’ means synchronising and connecting again two synchronised regions at the resynchronisation point;
‘resynchronisation’ means synchronising and connecting again twosynchronised regions at theresynchronisation point;
Article 33: 3.   Where more than one TSO fulfils the criteria under paragraph 2, the TSO with the highest number of potentialresynchronisation points between the twosynchronised regions shall be appointed as theresynchronisation leader, unless thefrequency leaders of the two synchronised regions agree to appoint another TSO as resynchronisation leader.
